function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Effectiveness of capturing viral particles is increased with increased rh, but may lead to overhumidification","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased window ventilation may expose occupants to extreme temperature profiles.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close proximity in buildings may promote potential viral transfer from one residence to another.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of the impact of natural light on sars-cov-2 indoors.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exposure to uvc light can pose safety concerns for room occupants if not properly installed or used.","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unexplored effects of daylight on indoor viruses and sars-cov-2 could lead to a lack of effective mitigation strategies.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of spectrally tuned electric lighting for disinfection indoors could lead to ineffective virus inactivation.","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uvc and uvgi light disinfectant strategies for buildings may have unintended consequences if not implemented with appropriate precaution.","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spatial configurations designed to encourage social interactions may inadvertently enhance opportunities for transmission of viruses.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited options for social-distancing measures in health care facilities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cohousing patients with vastly different requirements","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Positively pressurized protective environment pe rooms","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential migration of aerosols from patient rooms into higher traffic corridors, increasing the risk of spreading airborne pathogens.","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Involuntary exposure of room occupants to airborne pathogens from occupants of the corridor space due to negative pressure differentials.","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Drawbacks of anterooms in pe or aii rooms, including increased floor area, travel distance, and visual barrier between patients and care teams.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of general facility design for different patient conditions and operational requirements may lead to increased risk of viral transmission within the hospital or healthcare facility.","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in the number of individuals contracting covid-19 and being exposed to sars-cov-2","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited effectiveness of filtration techniques against pathogens such as sars-cov-2","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes required after original publication","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Viral particles too small for best filters","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imperfect filter systems","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear acknowledgment of contributors","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Downloading from an unsecured website","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of sars-cov-2 virus through droplets and fomites","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne spread of sars-cov-2 virus during aerosol-generating procedures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertain role of the faecal-oral route in sars-cov-2 transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Environmental sampling conducted in an airborne infectious-disease zone in a hospital.","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of bioaerosol samplers in a hospital environment can lead to potential aerosolized pathogen exposure.","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of dedicated covid-19 patient hospital infrastructure","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in patient rooms","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient air-cleaning routes in the airborne infectious-disease zone","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in the corridor","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative pressure in the ward","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate cleaning and disinfection schedule","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High number of positive air and surface samples indicating potential contamination","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive samples from isolation rooms indicate potential spread of the virus to other areas","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Toilet identified as the most contaminated environment","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of viral particles in bathroom surfaces and aerosols","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of hands during toilet usage","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Generation of bio-aerosols in drainage stacks after toilet flushing","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination and spread of viruses in the toilet area due to shared use by multiple patients, potentially leading to a higher risk of infection.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High transfer rate of viruses from smooth to rough surfaces may contribute to contamination in the toilet area.","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of positive samples in the toilet area and potential presence of sars-cov-2 in patient stool samples present an increased risk of viral spread in the built environment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Leakage of aerosols from isolation rooms to the corridor","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of weakly positive virus in corridor air and on exhaust grilles","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low airborne concentration of sars-cov-2 in the hospital","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Presence of aerosols in the bathroom","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of sars-cov-2 in an air-outlet fan","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Small number of collected air samples","category":"Health and safety risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Indoor air-temperature and relative humidity within a range favorable for microbial growth.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"}]}
